oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Transportation pass for Confederate Pvt. Simpson Evans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Transportation pass for Simpson Evans, giving him "permission to go to his home, and there remain undisturbed." He was born August 5, 1834, in Arkansas. Evans married Nancy Jane Coburn on February 28, 1858. He enlisted in Co. A, McGehee's Regiment, Ark. Cav., CSA, on June 17, 1862. He surrendered on May 17, 1865, and was paroled at Wittsburg, Arkansas, on May 25, 1865. Evans died April 16, 1910, in Fayette County, Tenn. He is buried at Mt. Pleasant Cemetery, Hickory Withe (Fayette County), Tenn.
